questions.question: According to the 'CEO Mindset' shift in Lesson 1, what is the primary indicator that a practitioner is successfully transitioning from a practitioner to a visionary?
options: Increasing the number of 1-on-1 clinical hours per week to maximize billing
Delegating technical and administrative tasks to focus on business systems and long-term strategy
Managing every social media comment and technical support ticket personally
Lowering prices to ensure the business stays competitive with entry-level providers
questions.explanation: The shift to a CEO mindset requires moving from 'working in' the business (clinical tasks) to 'working on' the business (strategy, systems, and delegation).

questions.question: In the context of scaling impact (Lesson 2), what is the primary financial advantage of a 1:Many group coaching model?
options: It eliminates the need for any marketing spend
It allows the practitioner to lower their effective hourly rate to help more people
It increases the practitioner's 'Earnings Per Hour' while typically lowering the 'Cost Per Client'
It removes the need for a structured curriculum
questions.explanation: Group coaching leverages the practitioner's time, allowing them to earn more per hour of work while providing a more accessible price point for the individual client.

questions.question: Lesson 3 discusses Digital Productization. Which of the following best defines an 'Evergreen' revenue stream?
options: A live, 3-day intensive workshop held once every spring
A high-intensity launch that occurs only during a specific 5-day window
A digital course or resource that is available for purchase and consumption 24/7 with automated delivery
A referral commission paid by a local medical clinic
questions.explanation: Evergreen products are decoupled from the practitioner's time and are available for purchase continuously through automated systems.

questions.question: When building a 'Strategic Partnership Ecosystem' (Lesson 4), which partner would be most strategically aligned for a Sexual Wellness Practitioner specializing in menopause?
options: A local criminal defense attorney
A compounding pharmacist or a functional medicine gynecologist
A general high-volume discount supplement retailer
A freelance graphic designer
questions.explanation: Strategic partnerships are most effective when they involve 'adjacent' professionals who serve the same target demographic (women in menopause) but offer different, non-competing services.

questions.question: According to Lesson 5 on Team Building, what is generally considered the most effective 'first hire' for a practitioner looking to scale?
options: A second senior practitioner to handle all clinical work
An Administrative Assistant or Operations Manager to handle scheduling, billing, and basic systems
A full-time videographer for daily content creation
An expensive external PR firm
questions.explanation: Freeing up the practitioner's time from administrative 'friction' is the fastest way to allow them to focus on revenue-generating activities and scaling.

questions.question: In Lesson 6, what is the primary objective of a 'High-Ticket Funnel' involving an application and a discovery call?
options: To pressure every prospect into buying regardless of fit
To automate the entire sales process so the practitioner never speaks to a client
To establish authority, filter for qualified leads, and ensure a high degree of client-practitioner fit
To hide the price of the program until the client has already paid a deposit
questions.explanation: High-ticket funnels for wellness services use applications and calls to ensure the practitioner can actually help the client and that the client is committed to the investment.

questions.question: Regarding 'Ethics and Risk at Scale' (Lesson 7), what is a critical requirement when transitioning from 1-on-1 work to group programs?
options: Group programs do not require Informed Consent forms
The practitioner must ensure that group interactions do not cross into individualized medical diagnosis or therapy
Practitioners should share client records with the whole group to foster community
Professional liability insurance automatically covers all group activities without notification
questions.explanation: Scaling requires clear boundaries to ensure the practitioner is providing education/coaching and not practicing medicine or therapy without the appropriate licenses in a group setting.

questions.question: Lesson 8 covers 'Legacy & Exit.' Which exit strategy involves the practitioner selling the business to an external buyer for a lump sum?
options: Passive Ownership
Acquisition
Licensing
Liquidation
questions.explanation: Acquisition is the process of an external entity or individual purchasing the brand, assets, and client base of the business.

questions.question: A practitioner spends $5,000 on ads for a group program launch. They enroll 10 students at $3,000 each. What is the Return on Ad Spend (ROAS)?
options: 2x ROAS
10x ROAS
6x ROAS
3x ROAS
questions.explanation: Total Revenue ($30,000) divided by Ad Spend ($5,000) equals a 6x ROAS.

questions.question: What is the 'Authority Marketing' principle of 'Content Depth' as described in Lesson 6?
options: Posting 10 times a day on every possible social platform
Creating long-form, insightful content that demonstrates expertise and solves a specific problem
Using clickbait headlines to get the maximum number of views
Only sharing personal photos and lifestyle content
questions.explanation: Authority is built through depthâ€”providing high-value, expert insights that position the practitioner as a leader in the sexual wellness field.
